results.title: Universe and I: Luna the lovely
results.brief_description: An introduction to concepts derived from the theory of relativity, emphasising the relationships between the dimensions of time and space, matter and energy, and set in the context of a science fiction filmmaker researching these issues. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Mind-slaughter
results.brief_description: A look at the atmosphere of the earth and other planets as oceans of gases providing planetary life-support systems, and the consequences of an experiment to create an atmosphere for human habitation on another planet at the cost of existing life forms. Dramatically presented but fascinating comparative analysis, nonetheless, of earth and venus’s atmosphere - with a view to human habitation on the latter. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Track stars: the unseen heroes of movie sound
results.creator_credit: Terry Burke, Film Arts and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Split-screen technique is used to demonstrate how “track stars” - movie sound specialists - painstakingly match sounds to the action of the characters who are being filmed.

results.title: Clockworks
results.creator_credit: Kent Stetson, Niall Burnett and Points East Productions
results.brief_description: Story about a Down’s syndrome child who eventually finds useful part-time employment with a clock repairer. Raises issues surrounding prejudice against the employment of the disabled.

results.title: The Navajo: shepherds of the desert
results.creator_credit: J. Donald McIntyre, Coleman Film Enterprises and Southventure Films
results.brief_description: Describes a day in the life of a typical Navajo family. Shows the family at work, the tending and shearing sheep, rug weaving and the family’s social life.

results.title: Houdini never died
results.brief_description: Examines the pervasive influence of Houdini on magicans throughout the world. Contains rare footage of Houdini and shows other noted magicans at work. Narrated by Burgess Meredith.

results.title: The Season
results.creator_credit: Donald MacDonald and Little Red Filmhouse
results.brief_description: The conflict between the innocence and commercialism of Christmas is illustrated by urban scenes of a parade featuring a spaceman and rollerskating donkey, the observations of an entrepreneur selling wildly colored trees, and the operation of a “Rent-a-Santa” service. This open-ended Academy Award nominated film allows the audience to form its own conclusions regarding the commercialization of a religious holiday.

results.title: Legendary West
results.creator_credit: Larry Klein, Stephen Dito and A Postweek Production
results.brief_description: The world’s knowledge of American Western history owes more to the American Western than it does to original documents. Shows the origins of the Western in the dime novels and newspaper reports and give a run down of the criteria used in the Western genre. Using archival material and extracts from Western films, a comprehensive study of both the myth and the reality emerges. The following film extracts are used: Bond of Blood; Local Colour; The Virginian; Tumbleweeds; Ride the High Country; Jesse James at bay; Stagecoach; The Big Trail. Narrated by Ben Johnson.
